DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this research study is to characterize the pharmacokinetics of intravenous ceftazidime/avibactam in patients with Cystic Fibrosis.
DOC.brief_title: Steady-state Pharmacokinetics of Ceftazidime/Avibactam in Cystic Fibrosis
DOC.detailed_description: Cystic fibrosis is a genetic disorder characterized by a chronic cycle of airway infection, obstruction, and inflammation leading to progressive loss of lung function and eventual respiratory failure. The principal pathogen is Pseudomonas aeruginosa which is present in the airways of 70% of adult patients with CF. Of particular concern is the increasing resistance observed to existing agents. While ceftazidime has been the mainstay of treatment for many years, its efficacy is limited by reduced susceptibility. Ceftazidime/avibactam offers a potential advancement in the management of infections involving P. aeruginosa in CF due to its excellent activity, penetration into pulmonary secretions, and reduced potential for development of resistance.
DOC.criteria: Diagnosis of CF based on positive sweat chloride or know CF mutation Age > 17 years Able to spontaneously expectorate sputum Any clinically significant laboratory abnormality Presence of an ongoing acute pulmonary exacerbation Pregnancy Serious past allergy to a betalactam antibiotic
